content:
Oh goodie, I get to post the first mention of this, in this stream. :smile:

So, I'm trying to be a compliant and unconfused user. I know we're supposed to stop using the Documents thing, and switch to S3 Connector. I have something to upload, but here's what I get:
image.png
@Dave deBronkart are you logged in?

Melva Peters said:

Dave deBronkart are you logged in?

image.png

Maybe your question could be appended to that error message ... :-/

I don't think we have control over the text of the error message- but we might be able to add something right under the heading - like "NOTE: You must be logged in!" - @Joshua Procious, is this possible?

@Lloyd McKenzie as much as I appreciate your effort, I don't want to suggest such accommodations. There are enough oddities to Confluence that a truly fundamental rule IMO is that one MUST be paying attention. I blame this totally on Atlassian, not HL7! (And on my own inattentiveness.)

I could indeed blame Atlassian for not trapping the specific error ("Error 987 - user not logged in") vs the passive-aggressive "Something didn't go well, and I'm not going to say a thing about it. It's YOUR problem." :-)

With my modest experience in UX, I'll note that it's a recurring trap if the system looks the same to a fast-moving inattentive user, whether or not they're logged in. If something visual & prominent changed upon login, then the incidence of such errors might shrink.

(Re something visual, I have four different gmail accounts, and it's sometimes essential that I not send from the wrong one. So I've used the Background setting to make each clearly distinct even if I'm moving fast.)
@Lloyd McKenzie I will look into it. I will defer to @Dave deBronkart 's description.
